- Fossil fuels are made from decomposing plants and animals. They contain hydrocarbons and occur within the earth’s crust. They are used as a source of energy and include coal, petroleum, natural gas and heavy oils. Reference: https://africacheck.org/fact-checks/meta-programme-fact-checks/no-term-fossil-fuel-not-coined-jd-rockefeller-and-oil-does published on 2022-05-23 00:00:00

- “Oil, wax and resin are all byproducts of the coalification process where heavy hydrocarbons are precipitated, to form coal, and the light hydrocarbons migrate off until they are trapped in a geologically suitable trap,” Drennan explained. The light hydrocarbons then – sometimes – accumulate to form a reserve of oil or gas. “Once depleted, the oil or gas reserve is done for,” she said. Reference: https://africacheck.org/fact-checks/meta-programme-fact-checks/no-term-fossil-fuel-not-coined-jd-rockefeller-and-oil-does published on 2022-05-23 00:00:00

- Oil also isn’t created quickly, and while it may be abundant, experts said that doesn’t mean it’s all readily available. Reference: https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2022/apr/08/facebook-posts/john-d-rockefeller-didnt-coin-term-fossil-fuels-tr/ published on 2022-04-08 00:00:00
correction_response: This tweet is misinformed. The term "fossil fuel" was not coined by J.D. Rockefeller, but by German chemist Caspar Neumann in 1759, long before Rockefeller's time (https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2022/apr/08/facebook-posts/john-d-rockefeller-didnt-coin-term-fossil-fuels-tr/). Furthermore, oil is not a self-replenishing resource. It takes millions of years to form and cannot be replaced once extracted and consumed (https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2022/apr/08/facebook-posts/john-d-rockefeller-didnt-coin-term-fossil-fuels-tr/). The claim that oil regenerates faster than it can be depleted is unsupported by evidence (https://africacheck.org/fact-checks/meta-programme-fact-checks/no-term-fossil-fuel-not-coined-jd-rockefeller-and-oil-does).
note_1_text: Rockefeller didn't come up with the term "Fossil Fuels", didn't pay scientists to use it to pretend it was scarce, and oil/coal/natural gas take millenia to form, meaning it takes longer for them to be formed then to be consumed.  https://www.reuters.com/article/factcheck-fossil-fuel-rockefeller/fact-check-the-term-fossil-fuel-was-not-coined-by-john-d-rockefeller-to-trick-people-into-thinking-oil-is-a-scarce-commodity-idUSL1N2QQ1UK
note_2_text: Huge quantities of petroleum are in the Earth and in tar pits that rise to the surface, even far below the deepest wells developed to extract it. refute_evidences: - While he made a lot of money off oil, he didn’t coin the term "fossil fuel" to drive up the price. It was, instead, conceived by a German chemist named Caspar Neumann and can be found in the index of the 1759 English translation of "The Chemical Works of Caspar Neumann. Reference: https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2022/apr/08/facebook-posts/john-d-rockefeller-didnt-coin-term-fossil-fuels-tr/ published on 2022-04-08 00:00:00

- There is no evidence available that oil “regenerates within the earth faster than it can ever be depleted” – quite the opposite. As the Geological Survey of Ireland explains, fossil fuels are non-renewable. Reference: https://africacheck.org/fact-checks/meta-programme-fact-checks/no-term-fossil-fuel-not-coined-jd-rockefeller-and-oil-does published on 2022-05-23 00:00:00

- According to archives at Pennsylvania State University in the US, the term was first coined by the German chemist Caspar Neumann in 1759, in the index of his book The Chemical Works of Caspar Neumann. We could find no evidence that Rockefeller had anything to do with the popularisation of the term fossil fuels. Reference: https://africacheck.org/fact-checks/meta-programme-fact-checks/no-term-fossil-fuel-not-coined-jd-rockefeller-and-oil-does published on 2022-05-23 00:00:00

- Rockefeller is not responsible for coining the term "fossil fuel" in 1892 — it was being used well before he was born — and fossil fuels do, in fact, come from decomposing organisms. Reference: https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2022/apr/08/facebook-posts/john-d-rockefeller-didnt-coin-term-fossil-fuels-tr/ published on 2022-04-08 00:00:00
